content: How can I help you today?
I've been having a lot of trouble sleeping lately. My mind just won't stop racing, and it's been really tough to relax at night, especially with everything going on at work.
It sounds like the difficulty sleeping has been really weighing on you, especially with the stress from work. What has this been like for you, and how has it affected your daily life?

It's been exhausting, honestly. I wake up feeling drained, and it’s hard to focus at work or even spend quality time with my family. It feels like this cycle I can’t break—stress keeps me up, and lack of sleep only makes everything feel worse.

It sounds like this cycle has been really challenging for you, taking a toll not only on your energy but also on your ability to focus and connect with your loved ones. That must be frustrating for you. What have you tried so far to deal with the stress or improve your sleep?

Honestly, not much. I’ve tried lying in bed earlier, but that just gives me more time to think, and I’ve attempted watching TV to distract myself, but it doesn’t help. I think I just feel so overwhelmed with everything going on that I can’t properly relax.

It sounds like you've been trying to find ways to cope, even if they haven’t been working as you'd hoped. Feeling overwhelmed seems to make relaxation even harder for you. What do you wish could be different in this situation?

I just wish I could shut my brain off at night and stop worrying all the time. If I could feel a little more secure about work and have some peace of mind, I think it would really help me sleep better and feel more present for my family.

You're longing for that peace of mind, both to settle your thoughts at night and to feel more secure in your work life. It seems like being present for your family is something really important to you, too. What's been on your mind most when you're trying to sleep?

Mostly, I just keep thinking about the possibility of getting fired. I worry about how I’d support my family if that happened, and then my brain starts spiraling. I go over every little mistake I’ve made at work or all the things I didn’t get done, and it just doesn’t stop. It feels like there’s so much at stake.

It sounds like the fear of losing your job and the pressure to support your family have been creating a lot of stress for you, and replaying those worries at night makes it feel even heavier. How do you think you might start easing some of the weight of those thoughts?

It feels like this fear is always looming over me, and I honestly don’t know how to ease it. I’ve thought about trying to work harder or do everything perfectly, but it feels like no matter what I do, it’s not enough. I just don’t know where to start.

The pressure to do everything perfectly and the sense that it’s never enough sound overwhelming. It must be really tough carrying that fear with you all the time. What would it look like if you could take just one step toward feeling more secure or finding ways to relax?

Maybe if I could find a moment in my day to stop and breathe or just clear my head, it might help, though I don’t even know where I’d start with that. Or, honestly, if I could feel more confident at work, like I’m not on the edge of being fired all the time, that would ease a lot of the weight I’m carrying.

Taking moments during your day to breathe and clear your head sounds like a way to create some space for yourself amidst the worries. Feeling more confident at work also seems like a meaningful goal—one that could help ease the fears you're dealing with. Is there something specific that might help you feel more confident, or support your ability to take those moments to breathe and unwind?

Taking moments during your day to breathe and clear your head sounds like a way to create some space for yourself amidst the worries. Feeling more confident at work also seems like a meaningful goal—something that could ease the fears you're carrying. Is there anything specific you think is holding you back from feeling more confident or relaxed right now?

It sounds like self-doubt and constant stress might be weighing heavily on you, making it hard to feel confident or take time to relax. What do you think could help you start shifting those feelings, even in small ways?

I think it’s the fear of not being good enough or making a mistake. It’s like I’m constantly second-guessing myself, especially when I see others at work who seem so on top of everything. I don’t know how to break out of that mindset.

It sounds like comparing yourself to others and second-guessing your abilities has been creating a lot of doubt for you. Recognizing that fear of not being good enough seems like an important step, though. What strengths or qualities of yours do you think might help you start building some confidence?

I guess I do work really hard and try my best to be dependable, especially because I know my family depends on me. I care about doing a good job and being there for the people I care about, but sometimes it feels like that’s not enough. I don’t know if that’s really a strength, though.

Your dedication to working hard and being dependable for your family shows just how much you care, and that sounds like a significant strength. It can be challenging to recognize those qualities as enough when you're feeling overwhelmed, but they seem to be a strong foundation. What would it look like for you to build on that and start believing in your ability to handle these worries?
